p:
The role of other viral proteins in airborne transmission has so far remained elusive. The study of Zhang et al.
16 demonstrated that the PA, NS, M, NA and NP genes are important to confer airborne transmission; however, the key amino-acid substitutions remain unknown. In addition, it has been suggested that H5N1 viruses that acquire a long stalk NA through reassortment may be more likely to be transmitted among humans.
121
